title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children node listing is not displayed. This issue occurs when performing the following steps: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. The new data source has no database/table/column information. Actual Result: The children node listing is not displayed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Closing the data set editor and reopening it does not resolve the issue.
SR: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Description: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children node listing is not displayed. Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. Open the data set editor and go to the data source page. 3. Change the data source to a new one. 4. The new data source should have no database/table/column information. Actual Result: The children node listing is not displayed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Closing the data set editor and reopening it does not resolve the issue.
